channel.title: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links
channel.description:
Figured I would post some.. Why not? [img]http://img89.imageshack.us/img89/2081/pikakp5.gif[/img]
[URL=http://forums.devshed.com/showpost.php?p=1497954&postcount=5]Basic resources for learning Java[/URL] [URL=http://forums.devshed.com/showpost.php?p=1486793&postcount=3]Java Technology FAQ's[/URL] [URL=http://forums.devshed.com/showpost.php?p=1486794&postcount=4]Classpath resources[/URL] [URL=http://forums.devshed.com/showpost.php?p=1500357&postcount=6]Servlets & JSP[/URL] [URL=http://access1.sun.com/FAQSets/newtojavatechfaq.html]New to Java™ Technology FAQs[/URL] [URL=http://access1.sun.com/FAQSets/javaprogfaq.html]Java™ Programming FAQs[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/reference/faqs/index.html]Java™ - Reference FAQs[/URL] [URL=http://www.ibiblio.org/javafaq/javafaq.html]The comp.lang.java FAQ List[/URL] [URL=http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javapedia/ClassPath]Javapedia: Classpath[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/findingclasses.html]How Classes are Found[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/windows/classpath.html]Setting the class path (Windows)[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/solaris/classpath.html]Setting the class path (Solaris/Linux)[/URL] [URL=http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/edu/j-dw-javaclass-i.html]Understanding the Java ClassLoader[/URL]
Here are some resources I've found [b]especially[/b] helpful for folks new to Java:
[URL=http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/install-windows.html]Installation Notes - JDK 5.0 Microsoft Windows (32-bit)[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/getStarted/cupojava/index.html]Your First Cup of Java[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/learning/new2java/index.html]New to Java Center[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/]The Java™ Tutorial - A practical guide for programmers[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/index.html]The Java™ Tutorial - Trail: Learning the Java Language[/URL] [URL=http://leepoint.net/notes-java/index.html]Java Programming Notes - Fred Swartz[/URL] [URL=http://www.ibiblio.org/obp/thinkCSjav/]How To Think Like A Computer Scientist[/URL] [URL=http://chortle.ccsu.ctstateu.edu/CS151/cs151java.html]Introduction to Computer Science using Java[/URL] [URL=http://javaalmanac.com/]The Java Developers Almanac 1.4[/URL]
[URL=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/concepts/][b]Object-Oriented Programming Concepts[/b][/URL] [URL=http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-04-2001/jw-0406-java101.html][b]Object-oriented language basics[/b][/URL] [URL=http://sepwww.stanford.edu/sep/josman/oop/oop1.htm][b]Don't Fear the OOP[/b][/URL]
[b]Books:[/b] [URL=http://www.sun.com/books/catalog/gosling_JPL4.xml]The Java Programming Language - 4th Edition[/URL] [URL=http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0596004656?v=glance]Head First Java[/URL], by Bert Bates and Kathy Sierra [URL=http://mindview.net/Books/DownloadSites]Thinking in Java (Free online)[/URL], by Bruce Eckel [URL=http://www.horstmann.com/corejava.html]Core Java[/URL], by Cay Horstmann and Gary Cornell [URL=http://www.amazon.co.uk/exec/obidos/Author=Bloch,%20Josh]Effective Java[/URL], by Joshua Bloch [url=http://math.hws.edu/javanotes/]Introduction to Programming Using Java[/url] [url=http://www.cafeconleche.org/books/xmljava/]Processing XML with Java[/url]
[b]Resources for learning about Servlets & JSP:[/b]
[URL=http://www.wickedlysmart.com/HeadFirst/HeadFirstServlets/HeadFirstJavaServlets.html]Head First Servlets & JSP[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/j2ee/1.4/docs/tutorial/doc/Servlets.html#wp69957]The J2EE™ 1.4 Tutorial - Java Servlet Technology[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/j2ee/tutorial/1_3-fcs/doc/JSPIntro.html]The J2EE™ Tutorial - JavaServer Pages Technology[/URL]
Most of these links provided by: Yawmark from Devshed forums. Others by me a LONG time ago. Dev shed is dead now :(
Hope you find these useful :) Feel free to post links so I can add them ;)
Other Links: [URL=http://javafaq.nu/java-article1006.html]Java Lessons[/URL], by Jon Huhtala [URL=http://www.moparisthebest.com/java/]Java Books List[/URL], Tons of books [URL=http://leetcenter.com/java.php]LeetCenter[/URL] [URL=http://www.sean.cruels.net/java]List of Java shit[/URL] [URL=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/index.html]Swing API[/url] [URL=http://leetcenter.com/remix/downloads.php?cat_id=5]LeetCenter2[/url] [URL=http://www.javaolympus.com/]Java Olympus[/URL] [URL=http://www.j2eeolympus.com/]J2ee Olympus[/URL] [URL=http://www.jspolympus.com/]Jsp Olympus[/URL] [URL=http://www.j2meolympus.com/]J2me Olympus[/URL] [URL=http://www.aquaphoenix.com/lecture/java6/page3.html]Java Lecture[/URL] [URL=http://lwjgl.org/]Lwjgl.org[/URL] [URL=http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/products/GTGE/]Golden Studios[/URL] [URL=http://mindprod.com/jgloss/remotefileaccess.html]Remote File Access[/URL] [URL=http://www.jmonkeyengine.com/index.php?option=com_frontpage&Itemid=1]Jmonkey Engine[/URL] [URL=http://renaud.waldura.com/doc/java/final-keyword.shtml]The Final Word[/URL] [URL=http://www.devdaily.com/java/edu/pj/pj_hourglass_cursor/]Java/AWT Example[/URL] [URL=http://javacooperation.gmxhome.de/indexEng.html]Java Cooperation[/URL] [URL=http://www.softlookup.com/tutorial/games/index.asp]Soft lookup.com[/URL] [URL=http://www.lagex.net/e-books.html]Some E-books[/URL] [url=http://www.techbooksforfree.com/java.shtml]Java books, free downloads[/url] [url=http://www.onlinecomputerbooks.com/view.php?book=www.samspublishing.com/library/library.asp?b=STY_Java2_24hours&t=Sams+Teach+Yourself+Java+2+in+24+Hours]Sams Teach Yourself Java 2 in 24 Hours[/url] [url=http://www.onlinecomputerbooks.com/view.php?book=mindview.net/Books/TIJ/DownloadSites&t=Thinking+in+Java,+3rd+Edition]Thinking in Java 3rd Edition[/url] [url=http://www.onlinecomputerbooks.com/view.php?book=www.brpreiss.com/books/opus5/html/book.html&t=Data+Structures+and+Algorithms+with+Object-Oriented+Design+Patterns+in+Java]Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Java[/url] [url=http://www.onlinecomputerbooks.com/view.php?book=java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/information/download.html&t=The+Java+Tutorial+Third+Edition]The Java Tutorial Third Edition [/url] [url=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/]Java Language Specification[/url] [url=http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jni/]Java Native Interface: Programmer's Guide and Specification[/url] [url=http://www.mindview.net/Books/TIJ/]Thinking in Java[/url] [url=http://java.sun.com/developer/onlineTraining/Programming/JDCBook/index.html]Advanced Programming for the Java 2 Platform[/url] [url=http://www.scism.sbu.ac.uk/jfl/jibook/]A Java GUI Programmer's Primer[/url]
[code]Updated - February 7th 2007 at 03:33:06 PM Updated - March 5th 2007 at 12:00:20 PM[/code]

item.title: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links
item.dc:creator: @Smokey2 Smokey_
item.description:
@Smokey2 wrote:

This:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/codeconvtoc-136057.html

That should be on your list, why it’s not is beyond my understanding…

Also, I didn’t read everything on the list but possibly:

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/ ?

Those are some of the most useful tutorials I’ve ever read.

Also:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/tutorialLearningPaths.html

This is extremely useful:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/information/glossary.html

Probably should read up on the GPL’s and other licenses as well:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/

Like I said though, you may already have these, I didn’t read the list much. But secondary input is always helpful right?

Read full topic

Sams Teach Yourself Java 2 in 24 HoursThinking in Java 3rd Edition
Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Java
The Java Tutorial Third Edition
Java Language Specification
Java Native Interface: Programmer’s Guide and Specification
Thinking in Java
Advanced Programming for the Java 2 Platform
A Java GUI Programmer’s Primer

Hope theese are helpful to many other people. took me a long time to find ^>^
i got some of theese from this site ii read all and its a great site…
http://www.techbooksforfree.com/java.shtml[/quote]

List updated.

item.source: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links

item.title: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

vadlapatis:

Hey guys , i’m interested in Java, new Programming, so please let me know where to start , also guide which one i have to pick Java, Vb.Net, C#

As davidude36 has mentioned, it all relies on personal preferance, I personally would recommend Java because it is a language which will teach you good habits, such as practicing correct programming procedures, i.e Object Orientated Programming.

To be honest, once you have got the grasp on Java, all C# is, is a matter of remember what does what, as the syntax and lang itself is very similar to Java’s.

Read full topic
item.source: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links

item.title: Resources for learning Java - Tons of links
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Java, VB.net and C# are 3 different programming language. Pick which one you want to learn then learn it. I think java is the best out of those three but its personal preference and depends what you want to do with the language.

Also use the tutorials posted in this thread to learn the basics of java. Good luck.

Read full topic

@exps35 wrote:
